page.title: 09WAKEFIELD PRISON Page 1.
page.content: The prison serves as one of the 8 nationwide 'dispersal prisons' for long term (over 4 years and up to life) sentenced prisoners. The average number of inmates is just in excess of 700 on a daily basis, approximately 50% of them serving life sentences. The prisoners are housed in 4 main 'wings' or blocks, each having cell space for up to 180 inmates. The daily routine includes breakfast, work in engineering, textile, or miscellaneous workshops, lunch, further work on all weekdays (Monday to Friday inclusive), a tea meal, and then a period of leisure activities ('association') on each evening of the week and at weekends. Sports and games feature prominently in the leisure curriculum including football, volleyball, running,and gymnasium work including weight lifting. >>>>>next page.
